name: Ethical Angel
slogan: The Employee Engagement Engine with a Social Impact By-Product
description:
We provide the Ethical Angel employee engagement platform. Our platform:

Standardises the needs of causes(global charities, NGOs, social enterprises) via templates, creating uniform projects for users

It then profiles private sector employees "users"and mobilises them with personalised nudges,rewards and content to complete these projects.

This leads to high uptake and more benefits to people, planet and profit.

jobs.title: Experience Lead (B2B Sales)
jobs.description:
**About You**:

Ethical Angel has ambitious growth plans, expecting to at least quadruple in size over the next year. To help us accomplish this,  we are now looking for a great B2B salesperson to perform outreach to prospective clients. 

This is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a dynamic business, unleash your inner entrepreneur and support some of the world’s most pressing charitable causes. 

In your role you can expect to:

1. Report directly to the CEO, take ownership of the entire sales cycle, from developing a pipeline of targeted b2b outreach leads to closing sales
2. Develop a strong grasp of our unique technology, understanding how, why and when it is used to achieve return on investment for our clients
3. Undertake meaningful evaluations of customer success and drive it forward as a liaison between clients and internal teams
4. Plan and implement and evaluate effective and engaging digital communication and marketing campaigns
5. Attend networking events with view to widening Ethical Angel’s stakeholder network
6. Be willing to work across different aspects of the business as is often required within a small team

The successful candidate for this position will have:

1. At least two years of demonstrable success in a B2B technology sales environment
2. No hesitation in making cold and warm outreach calls to potential and existing clients
3. Deep understanding of solution selling, including sales forecasting, negotiation and account management
4. Ambitions to progress within the business and an aptitude for leadership
5. Proven track record of developing and maintaining business relationships
6. An ability to effectively analyse information and pick up new skills quickly
7. Fluency in English
8. Experience of working within a team
9. Strong numeracy skills
10. Strong IT skills including the G-Suite (e.g Doc/Sheets) and/or Microsoft Office (e.g Word/Excel)

The following attributes would be advantageous: 

1. Digital marketing expertise
2. Familiarity with the human resources, learning and development or corporate social responsibility business functions (target markets)

Working at Ethical Angel is a unique opportunity to participate in an ongoing start up success story with a massive social impact. In tandem with our growth, you can expect a clearly mapped path to progression within the business and constant opportunities to collaborate with other functions, with your ideas heard and implemented across the business. 
 
Currently all staff are working from home in line with Government advice due to the COVID-19 outbreak, and so this role will initially be undertaken remotely. When not in lockdown, we are easy to get to, located in Zone 2 and <10 minutes walk from the nearest railway station. We offer early finishes on Fridays and regular staff incentives for outstanding results. Other benefits, including access to an employee share pool for all employees, are in consultation and we expect to roll-out these out within the next six months. 
 
**Application process:**
 
Please submit a cover letter and CV (neither more than two pages, provided in PDF format) to laurence@ethicalangel.com by 18:00 GMT on 29/05/2020. Interviews are expected to take place during the w/c 08/06/2020.
 
Successful candidates will be invited to interview via video call. Candidates who stand-out at the interview will then be asked to present as finalists to our leadership team as a practical exercise. We will provide feedback for every candidate invited to interview.
 
**Equal Opportunities**:

EA is a equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate.

jobs.title: Customer Success Lead
jobs.description:
**About You:**
 
Ethical Angel has ambitious growth plans, expecting to at least quadruple in size over the next year. To help us accomplish this, we are now looking for amazing customer success lead to help cultivate our growing user community, scale up our processes and maximise customer satisfaction across our platform.
 
This is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a dynamic business, unleash your inner entrepreneur and support some of the world’s most pressing charitable causes. 

In your role you can expect to:

1. Reporting to the CEO, lead the Ethical Angel Customer Success function by maximising customer satisfaction, customer retention and platform adoption
2. Develop a deep understanding of the Ethical Angel platform, including the ROI proposition and benchmarks for client success
3. Conduct customer success planning for our portfolio of clients, anticipating their needs before they arise
4. Guide new clients through an intuitive onboarding process, from platform launch through to performance reporting
5. Closely monitor customers’ KPIs and user metrics with the view to isolating bottlenecks and inefficiencies in the customer lifecycle and addressing them effectively and efficiently
6. Act as a dynamic and responsive point of contact for a selection of users, resolving or escalating customer technical issues in a timely manner
7. Arrange and deliver customer success events such as launch events, drop-in sessions and webinars
8. Advise and train clients to the point of self-sufficiency, including the development of training materials and content
9. Communicate customers' needs to the Development team view to scaling and improving our products and processes to match growth in line with our product roadmap
10. Independently experiment with innovative, data-driven approaches to give our clients the greatest possible experience
11. Support the Sales team in realising renewal, upsell and cross-sell opportunities

The successful candidate for this position will have:

1. At least two years of experience of maximising customer success in a technology environment
2. The ability immerse yourself in the world of your clients, learning how to change behaviours and processes that deliver meaningful business impact
3. Proven track record of developing and maintaining business relationships
4. An aptitude for data management and the ability to derive and present actionable insights from said data
5. A self-starter attitude; able to independently problem solve both strategic challenges and troubleshoot day-to-day issues as they arise
6. Capable of driving exponential rates of renewal, expansion and advocacy through proactive and intuitive client communication
7. Strong verbal and written communication skills 
8. Ambitions to progress within the business and an aptitude for leadership
9. Outgoing with proven interpersonal skills
10. Interest in the technology sector
11. Fluency in English
12. Experience of working within a team
13. Strong numeracy skills
14. Strong IT skills including the G-Suite (e.g Doc/Sheets) and/or Microsoft Office (e.g Word/Excel)

The following attributes would be advantageous: 

1. Digital marketing expertise
2. Familiarity with the human resources, learning and development or corporate social responsibility business functions (target markets)

Working at Ethical Angel is a unique opportunity to participate in an ongoing start up success story with a massive social impact. In tandem with our growth, you can expect a clearly mapped path to progression within the business and constant opportunities to collaborate with other functions, with your ideas heard and implemented across the business. 
 
Currently all staff are working from home in line with Government advice due to the COVID-19 outbreak, and so this role will initially be undertaken remotely. When not in lockdown, we are easy to get to, located in Zone 2 and <10 minutes walk from the nearest railway station. We offer early finishes on Fridays and regular staff incentives for outstanding results. Other benefits, including access to an employee share pool for all employees, are in consultation and we expect to roll-out these out within the next six months. 
 
**Application process:**
 
Please submit a cover letter and CV (neither more than two pages, provided in PDF format) to laurence@ethicalangel.com by 18:00 GMT on 29/05/2020. Interviews are expected to take place during the w/c 08/06/2020.
 
Successful candidates will be invited to interview via video call. Candidates who stand-out at the interview will then be asked to present as finalists to our leadership team as a practical exercise. We will provide feedback for every candidate invited to interview.
 
**Equal Opportunities**:
 
EA is a equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate.
